p: Pericarps from P. speciosa show significant inhibitory activity (IC 50 0.0581 mg/mL; 89.46%) against α-glucosidase [ 156], an enzyme responsible for breaking down starch and polysaccharide into glucose [ 159]. The seeds also show inhibitory activity but at lower percentage (45.72%) [ 156]. In another study, the ethanol extract of the rind had the highest α-glucosidase inhibitory activity followed by the leaf and seed with IC 50 of 4596 ppm, 54,341 ppm, and 67,425 ppm, respectively as compared with acarbose having 162,508 ppm [ 158].
